title: 81% Pak Military Hardware Of Chinese-Origin, China Uses It As "Live Lab": Army
content: An overwhelming 81 per cent of Pakistan's military hardware is of Chinese origin, with China using the country like a "live lab" to test its military tech, the army said.

title: Where Do Trade Talks Stand In Rush To Avert Higher US Tariffs?
content: As a Wednesday deadline approaches for steeper US tariffs to hit dozens of economies ranging from the EU to India, trade negotiations with President Donald Trump's administration are coming down to the wire.

title: All About Jane Street, US Trading Firm Barred From Indian Markets
content: India has barred one of the world's largest quant trading firms, Jane Street, from accessing its securities market after an investigation found it made "unlawful gains", taking the most stringent action ever against a foreign trading firm.

title: Trump's Tariff Plans Would Cost US Employers $82.3 Billion: Analysis
content: An analysis finds a critical group of US employers would face a direct cost of $82.3 billion from President Donald Trump's current tariff plans, a sum that could potentially be managed

title: 'Mango' Mishra Drank Every Evening At College Union Room, Turned It Into Bar
content: Monojit Mishra, alias 'Mango', has been arrested for allegedly raping a 24-year-old student inside the college last month.

title: US Immigration Crackdown Set To Intensify With $150 Billion Infusion
content: US immigration enforcement is set for the most dramatic expansion in decades after the Republican-controlled Congress approved a budget bill that will fund President Donald Trump's mass deportation plans.

title: Air India vs UK Law Firm Over Alleged Threat To Crash Victims' Families
content: The families of the victims of the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad last month have accused the Tata Group-owned airline of "forcing" them to make financial disclosures under the "threat of receiving no advance compensation".

title: Biden Administration Emptied Out Whole Country Giving Ukraine Weapons: Trump
content: President Donald Trump complained Thursday that the United States provided too many weapons to Ukraine under the previous administration, his first public comments on the pause in some shipments as Russia escalates its latest offensive.

title: 'Hug Therapy': How Pope Leo Is Trying To Unify Vatican
content: Pope Leo XIV heads off on holiday on Sunday, having spent his first two months as Catholic leader rebuilding unity and bolstering tradition after his predecessor's unorthodox papacy.

title: Angered Over Her Affair, UP Man Stabs Wife To Death With A Knife
content: A man allegedly stabbed his wife to death and his friend was also killed during the ensuing argument in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras on Thursday, police said.

title: Sub Lt Astha Poonia Becomes 1st Woman To Be Trained As Navy Fighter Pilot
content: Sub Lieutenant Astha Poonia has become the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot of the Indian Navy. She may eventually fly the MiG-29K or the naval version of the Rafale fighter jet off India's aircraft carriers.

title: 44 External Injuries: Autopsy Report In Tamil Nadu Custodial Death Case
content: A man in Tamil Nadu who was allegedly killed while in police custody suffered 44 external and many internal injuries, according to the autopsy report. The report said a linear 3-cm scar and three other old scars are consistent with cigarette burns.

title: Prada Dragged To Court Over Rs 1.2 Lakh Kolhapuri Chappals: "Pay Back Indians"
content: The Italian luxury fashion brand featured the leather flat sandals (similar to Kolhapuri chappals), priced at approximately Rs 1.2 lakh, at the recent Milan runway show.

title: Asian, Black: How Zohran Mamdani Described Himself In Columbia Application
content: Zohran Mamdani, the Indian-origin Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, listed his race as both "Asian" and "Black or African American" on his 2009 application to Columbia University, the New York Times reported.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Dragon-Scorpion Embrace, And Why India Can't Afford To Ignore It
content: The "two-front" conundrum involving Pakistan and China is not a hypothetical scenario for India; it is a live challenge that necessitates constant vigilance and strategic preparedness.

title: Video Of 'Thin' Bihar Building Viral, Internet Calls It "Great Wall of China"
content: At first glance, standing in front of it, you may consider it a normal house. But move to the side for the surprise. It's arguably one of the most bizarre buildings ever constructed, and that's what has made it the centre of all attention.

title: "They Pulled Down My Pants": UP Dhaba Staff On Kanwar Yatra Crackdown
content: A controversy has erupted in Uttar Pradesh ahead of the Kanwar Yatra, after a Muslim man named Tajammul was found working under the assumed identity of "Gopal" at a roadside dhaba to protect himself from Hindu groups.

title: Rajya Sabha's New Session To Begin On July 21, First After Op Sindoor, Pahalgam Attack
content: The session will run from July 21 to August 21, with the House set to adjourn on August 12 and reconvene on August 18 due to independence day.

title: China Plans Cash Rewards To Boost Birthrate, Growth
content: China is planning to offer cash handouts to families as an incentive for couples to have children, according to people familiar with the matter, as years of population decline threatens the world's No. 2 economy.

title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'
content: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.

title: Delhi double murder: Boy walked into scene of mother's murder, tried to hide in bathroom
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar, Mukesh Paswan, a garment worker, murdered his employer's wife and teenage son. The gruesome crime occurred after a dispute over a Rs 45,000 advance and Paswan's absenteeism. He was arrested in UP while attempting to flee.

title: Himachal rain crisis: 69 dead, many missing; rescue ops on
content: Torrential rains and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh have claimed at least 69 lives and caused over Rs 400 crore in damages since June 20. Mandi district is the worst-hit, with homes collapsing and vehicles being swept away. Rescue operations are underway as the IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall and potential landslides.

title: Chess | 'No time for noise': Vidit Gujrathi hits out at 'LiverDoc' for insulting doctor parents, family
content: Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi defended his family members' professions after a social media user questioned their legitimacy as doctors on National Doctors' Day. The dispute arose when Gujrathi acknowledged his father, an ayurvedic specialist, mother, a cosmetologist, sister, a physiotherapist, and wife, a homeopathic doctor.

title: Aastha Poonia becomes 1st woman to be trained as a fighter pilot
content: Slt Aastha Poonia made history as the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot in the Indian Navy. She and Lt Atul Kumar Dhull were awarded the 'Wings of Gold' at @IN_Dega. This achievement marks a significant step towards gender inclusivity in Naval Aviation, promoting equality and opportunity within the Indian Navy.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: India to spend Rs 1L crore for spy planes, naval gear; China-Pak axis stirs urgency
content: Defence ministry has approved acquisition projects worth over Rs 1 lakh crore. The approvals include indigenous construction of mine countermeasure vessels, procurement of quick-reaction surface-to-air missile systems, and intelligence, surveillance, target acquisition & reconnaissance planes. Other projects include semi-submersible autonomous vessels, armored recovery vehicles, and electronic warfare systems to boost India's defense capabilities.

title: 'Till lion learns to write...': Radhika Gupta slams Prada amid sandals row; what she said
content: Prada faces online criticism for sandals resembling Indian Kolhapuri chappals without acknowledging the artisans. Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta emphasized the importance of crediting original creators and preserving India's textile heritage. Following backlash, Prada will meet with MACCIA on July 11 to discuss potential collaboration, including co-branded collections and skill development, aiming to recognize and benefit Kolhapuri artisans.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: Bharat Mobility Expo’s next edition announced: And it’s not next year! Details
content: The Bharat Mobility Global Expo is gearing up for its 2027 edition. The event will take place in Delhi NCR. It is scheduled from February 4 to 9. The expo will showcase automotive, logistics, and technology advancements. New segments will include multimodal, urban, and rural mobility. Tractors and agricultural solutions will also be highlighted.

title: Language row: Maha minister asks why 'Javed, Aamir' spared for not speaking Marathi
content: Following the assault of a shopkeeper in Mira Road for not speaking Marathi, Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane urged, "show courage, go to Null Bazaar, Mohammed Ali Road and tell people there to speak Marathi." The incident occurred after an argument over language, with the shopkeeper claiming he was slapped for stating that many languages are spoken in Maharashtra.

title: Jane Street ban: Why has SEBI barred US-based trading firm? Explained
content: India's SEBI has accused Jane Street of market manipulation, alleging the firm artificially inflated stock prices to benefit from options trading, generating substantial profits. The regulator has frozen Rs 4,844 crore and imposed a market ban on the global trading giant. Jane Street has the option to appeal the decision.

title: Amazon’s new milestone: Deploys one millionth robot in centers
content: Amazon has reached a milestone by deploying one million robots across its facilities and introducing "DeepFleet," a new AI model to optimize robot fleet efficiency. This move aims to reduce travel time and enhance delivery speeds. While Amazon emphasizes robots working alongside humans and creating new roles, CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges potential workforce reduction due to increased automation.

title: Secret wedding? New twist in honeymoon case; cops find second 'mangalsutra'
content: The brother of murdered Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi suspects Raja’s wife, Sonam, the prime suspect, may have secretly married her accomplice while in hiding after the honeymoon murder in Meghalaya. He criticized Sonam’s brother for expressing a desire to meet her after initially seeking forgiveness from the deceased's family.

title: 'Could get offended': Putin rushes out mid-event to take Trump's call - watch
content: Vladimir Putin paused a major event to take a call from Donald Trump, fearing offense at being kept waiting. The leaders engaged in a lengthy discussion covering topics such as Ukraine and Iran, though Trump expressed disappointment at the lack of progress on a Ukraine peace deal.

title: 'Turning point': Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce deepen off-camera relationship
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce enjoyed a peaceful summer in 2025. They spent quality time in New York, Nashville, and other quiet locations. This helped strengthen their relationship. Swift also regained ownership of her master recordings. Kelce supported her during this achievement. As the NFL season approaches, Swift will likely support Kelce at games.

title: Caitlyn Jenner manager Sophia Hutchins, 29, dies in Malibu ATV crash
content: Sophia Hutchins, Caitlyn Jenner's manager and a prominent transgender activist, tragically died in an ATV accident near Jenner's Malibu home at the age of 29. Hutchins, known for her work with the Caitlyn Jenner Foundation and appearances on 'I Am Cait,' was remembered for her dedication to transgender advocacy and her impact on the community.

title: Patrick Mahomes: Brittany’s bold NWSL bet became $275 M powerhouse
content: Brittany Mahomes' Kansas City Current, an NWSL expansion team, has seen remarkable growth, now valued at $275 million. Patrick Mahomes proudly supports Brittany's ventures, highlighting her vision in building a women's-specific stadium and facility. Patrick also revealed Brittany's desire to play soccer in Kansas City.

title: US-Iran deal on cards? Trump meets Saudi def min, Tehran in focus
content: President Trump met with Saudi Arabia's defense minister to discuss de-escalation with Iran and broader Middle East peace efforts, including ending the Gaza conflict and hostage release negotiations. The administration aims to expand the Abraham Accords, with potential new countries joining soon. These discussions occur amid heightened tensions following recent military operations and ongoing efforts to restart nuclear talks.

title: 'Bihar ki beti': PM Modi hails Indian roots of Trinidad & Tobago PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Trinidad and Tobago, marking the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister since 1999. He addressed the Indian community, acknowledging their contributions and strong ties to India. Modi referred to Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki Beti," highlighting her ancestral roots and the cultural connection between the two nations.

title: Ex-BJP functionary hacked to death in TN; manhunt launched
content: In Dindigul, Balakrishnan, a former BJP member, was murdered. The incident occurred near Madur Junction. A gang attacked him with billhooks. Balakrishnan died at the scene. Police suspect a monetary dispute as the motive. Sanarpatti police are investigating the case. They are searching for the suspects involved in the crime. The event happened on Thursday evening.

title: IND vs ENG: Insatiable Shubman Gill shows why he's undisputed leader of lineup
content: Shubman Gill is proving his mettle as India's new Test captain, silencing doubts with a remarkable performance in England. His dedication and hunger for runs were evident in his extensive training sessions. Gill's leadership extends beyond his own batting, as he actively supports the young batting group, fostering a confident and positive mindset within the team.

title: Sanjay Raut takes 'vikas purush' jibe at PM Modi over Varanasi roads
content: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena (UBT) leader, criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the deteriorating road conditions in Varanasi, his parliamentary constituency. Raut highlighted viral social media images of collapsed roads and difficulties faced by pilgrims.

title: 'Biggest bill ever signed': How 'beautiful' is Trump's mega bill - and for whom
content: House Republicans passed the 'ONE BIG BEAUTIFUL BILL,' securing President Trump's signature on July 4. The legislation makes permanent $4.5 trillion in tax cuts, introduces new tax breaks, and enacts $1.2 trillion in spending cuts targeting Medicaid and food stamps. It also allocates $350 billion for border security and raises the national debt ceiling by $5 trillion.

title: UFC fight at White House? How Trump wants to mark America's 250th I-Day
content: Donald Trump is considering hosting a UFC match on the White House grounds as part of the America 250 celebrations. The president announced this plan during a speech at the Iowa State Fairgrounds, mentioning his friendship with UFC CEO Dana White.

title: ‘It was always yours’: Kaanta Laga makers speak up after Shefali Jariwala’s death
content: Shefali Jariwala, famed for 'Kaanta Laga', passed away at 42 due to cardiac arrest. Directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru paid tribute. They confirmed 'Kaanta Laga' would never have a sequel. The directors shared memories of discovering Shefali. Her last rites were performed. The industry mourned the loss of the iconic 'Kaanta Laga' girl. Her contribution will always be remembered.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I missed my 300' - Shubman Gill gets emotional after parents' message
content: Shubman Gill's record-breaking 269 against England at Edgbaston was followed by an emotional moment as he received a congratulatory message from his parents. The BCCI captured Gill's post-match routine, including recovery, media duties, and a warm welcome at the hotel. Gill acknowledged the importance of his father's guidance in his cricketing journey, while also humorously lamenting missing his triple century.

title: TN custodial death: Postmortem confirms torture; internal bleeding in brain
content: The postmortem report of Sivaganga custodial death victim Ajith Kumar revealed multiple injuries. The report confirmed custodial torture. There were signs of internal bleeding in the brain, heart, and abdomen. Forensic experts noted abrasions and contusions all over Ajith Kumar's body. The autopsy was performed late. Further examination is pending to determine the exact cause of death.

title: 2nd Test: Jadeja hits back at Stokes - 'Why would I do that? My focus was on batting'
content: Ravindra Jadeja dismissed Ben Stokes' pitch tampering accusations as mind games after a heated exchange during the second Test at Edgbaston. The incident arose after Chris Woakes complained about Jadeja allegedly damaging the pitch's danger area. Jadeja, who scored a crucial 89 in India's dominant 587, defended his actions, stating his focus was on batting, not altering the pitch.

title: IND vs ENG 2nd Test: Shubman Gill's old video surfaces on day he scored 269 runs - watch
content: Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 propelled India to a commanding position in the second Test against England at Edgbaston. The 25-year-old captain surpassed records previously held by Indian legends like Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar. In the video, Gill emphasised on the importance of staying at the crease and playing grounded shots, showcasing his dedication to representing India.

title: B'luru cafe brawl: Staff attacked after denying extra cup; watch
content: Arun Kumar was arrested for allegedly assaulting a coffee shop employee in Sheshadripuram after an argument over an extra cup. The incident escalated when Haque, the cashier, refused to provide an additional empty cup, leading to a verbal exchange and physical altercation. CCTV footage captured Arun and his friends assaulting Haque, who retaliated with a sharp object.

title: Low salary hikes: Moonlighting on rise; IT firms tighten checks
content: The IT industry is seeing a significant increase in moonlighting-related background checks due to low salary increases and job market uncertainty. Verification firms are flagging more cases of overlapping employment, particularly in the IT services sector, as remote work makes it easier for professionals to take on additional roles.

title: 2nd Test: 'In Eng, you never feel set' - How Jadeja broke BCCI rule to get more practice
content: Ravindra Jadeja's crucial 89 and his significant partnership with Shubman Gill highlighted India's recovery on Day 2 against England. Jadeja, however, raised eyebrows by breaking BCCI protocols for extra practice, justifying it as vital preparation. He also refuted Ben Stokes' accusation of pitch tampering. With England struggling at 77 for 3, Jadeja hinted at further dominance from India.

title: AP ECET counselling 2025 kicks off today; registration now live at cets.apsche.ap.gov.in
content: AP ECET 2025 counselling registration has begun from July 4 at cets.apsche.ap.gov.in. Eligible candidates who scored at least 25% in the exam can register online, pay the fee, and upload documents. The process includes choice filling and seat allotment. Required documents include academic certificates, ID proof, and category documents. Final allotments depend on merit, preferences, and seat availability.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex near 83,300
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 25,400, BSE Sensex was up over 50 points.

title: Blackmail, fake parcel: How 'delivery agent' drugged, raped Pune techie in her flat
content: In Kondhwa, Pune, a 22-year-old data scientist was allegedly raped in her apartment by a man posing as a courier delivery agent. The assailant sprayed a chemical on her face, took a selfie with her, and threatened to upload it if she reported the crime.

title: Virtual Court Shocker in Gujarat: Lawyer sips beer, speaks on phone mid-hearing
content: The Gujarat High Court has taken action against Bhaskar Tanna. He is a senior advocate. The court issued a contempt notice. This followed a viral video. It showed Tanna using a phone and drinking from a beer mug during a hearing. Judges expressed concern. They said his behavior damaged the court's dignity. Further hearings are scheduled.

title: Mahhi Vij breaks silence on divorce rumours with husband Jay Bhanushali
content: A new promo for 'Laughter Chefs Season 2' teases drama and excitement, featuring Krushna Abhishek and Elvish Yadav. Krushna humorously seeks a remedy from a Pandit for Elvish's 'Supreme Court matter,' with the Pandit suggesting spousal support is key.

title: Jane Street ban: US trading firm barred by SEBI from accessing India's securities market
content: Indian market regulator SEBI has barred Jane Street from domestic markets, demanding the surrender of ₹4,843.57 crore in unlawful profits. The firm is accused of index manipulation during expiry days to gain in index options. Despite warnings from NSE, Jane Street allegedly resumed manipulative trading practices, leading to SEBI's intervention to protect investors.

title: IND v ENG: 'Opening was not his place' - Ganguly lauds Gill's majestic knock
content: Sourav Ganguly lauded Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 against England, calling it an "absolute masterclass" and suggesting No.4 is his ideal Test position. Gill's record-breaking double century propelled India to a massive total, putting them in a commanding position to level the series after losing the opener. Ganguly believes this Test is India's to win.

title: Russia first to officially recognise Afghanistan's Taliban govt
content: In a significant move, Russia has officially recognized the Taliban's leadership in Afghanistan, becoming the first nation to do so since their 2021 takeover. This decision follows Moscow's removal of the Taliban from its list of banned organizations. The Russian foreign ministry has received credentials from the new Afghan Ambassador, signaling enhanced bilateral cooperation.

title: Which is the most effective way to boost Vitamin D levels immediately
content: Vitamin D is crucial for bone health, immune function, and mood, yet deficiency is widespread due to limited sun exposure and poor diet. Sunlight is the most effective way to boost vitamin D levels, especially during midday when UVB rays are strongest.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 4 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential gains. They recommend buying UPL between Rs 670-690, targeting Rs 747, and Chennai Petroleum Corporation in the range of Rs 700-720, with a target of Rs 787.

title: No need to re-conduct NEET-UG 2025, affirms Division Bench of Madras High Court
content: The Division Bench confirms a single judge’s order rejecting the plea for re-examination by candidates who appeared in centres which suffered power disruption

title: Expert panel engaged by Vedanta recommends ‘green restart’ of Sterlite Copper plant in Thoothukudi
content: The committee proposes the plant can resume operations under stricter environmental regulations and with a more sustainable approach to production

title: Supreme Court refuses to intervene in HDFC Bank CEO’s plea as Bombay HC lists case on July 14
content: The Bench recorded in its order the multiple instances the case was adjourned in June, and conveyed its “hope and trust” that the High Court would “take up” the matter on July 14.

title: Search for terrorists in J&K’s Kishtwar enters day 3, cordon strengthened
content: The operation follows an encounter that broke out between the terrorists and the security forces in the heavily forested Kanzal Mandu area of the Kuchal-Chatroo belt

title: Karnataka CM’s remarks on Covid vaccines “factually incorrect” says Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Siddaramaiah hits back
content: Siddaramaiah had suggested that the recent heart attack deaths in Hassan district may be linked to the Covid-19 vaccination drive. He had also claimed the vaccines were ‘hastily’ approved.

title: End peace deals with Kuki armed groups, Manipur organisations tell Centre
content: The organisations representing the Meitei, Naga, and Thadou communities cited repeated violations of the Suspension of Operations agreements and a failure to maintain law and order

title: Supreme Court agrees to examine Tamil Nadu’s plea against Madras HC stay on nine Acts on V-C appointments in universities
content: The State argued that the High Court had ordered the stay on May 21 despite the Supreme Court, in an April 8 judgment, declaring that the Bills were granted ‘deemed assent’  by Governor R.N. Ravi.

title: Nipah virus: Kerala Health department sounds alert in three districts
content: Preventive and control measures will be carried out for the same duration in the three districts, with 26-member committees formed in each district.

title: Govt officials among 34 booked by CBI for manipulation of regulatory framework for medical colleges
content: The syndicate has its roots in the Union Health Ministry, where eight accused officials ran the sophisticated scheme facilitating unauthorised access, illegal duplication and dissemination of highly confidential files and sensitive information to representatives of medical colleges through a network of intermediaries in exchange for huge bribes, the CBI FIR alleged

title: Watch: Police convicted for recent custodial deaths in India: zero | Data Point
content: The Hindu’s Data team examines whether police personnel are held accountable for custodial deaths — and how cases of torture and deaths in custody often go unpunished

title: Shillong hawker eviction drive: Meghalaya High Court appoints special officer to ensure strict adherence to legal procedures
content: The division Bench of Chief Justice I.P. Mukerji and Justice W. Diengdoh appointed senior advocate Subhasis Chakrawarty as the Special Officer

title: 10 detained as protest by Unemployed JAC reaches BRK Bhavan in Hyderabad
content: Police warned students and job aspirants that involvement in such activities could lead to criminal charges that might jeopardise future career prospects

title: Nipah virus resurfaces in Kerala, two cases reported
content: 18-year-old girl who succumbed to acute encephalitis syndrome in Kozhikode and a 38-year-old woman undergoing treatment in Malappuram test positive for Nipah. National Institute of Virology, Pune, confirms Nipah infection in woman. Final result of girl awaited

title: Bodies of people allegedly murdered, raped buried in Dharmasthala village a decade ago; police to probe after man files complaint
content: The complainant who worked as sanitation worker in Dharmasthala from 1995 to 2014 has requested the police to conduct an inquiry by exhuming the remains. He has also offered to show them the places where the bodies were buried.

title: Kottayam medical college hospital incident: Minister Vasavan claims search efforts not delayed
content: Minister says his and Health Minister Veena George's remarks about no one being there in the collapsed structure were based on information provided by hospital authorities, including the medical superintendent

title: Pollachi’s coir industry eyes global recognition with GI tag application
content: Pollachi, known for its rich tradition in coir manufacturing, boasts over 500 registered manufacturers engaged in coir and related products

title: Kaliganj blast: One more held from Bengal's Palashi, total arrests rise to 10
content: A 13-year-old girl was killed in Molandi village of Kaliganj after bombs were allegedly hurled from a Trinamool Congress victory celebration

title: Puducherry accelerates its fight against TB; ranks number one in IRL for chest diseases
content: “India has strengthened its TB response with advanced diagnostics, innovative policies, private sector partnerships, and a patient-first approach,” said the Union Health Ministry.

title: Stamp papers worth ₹13.50 lakh stolen from Gannavaram Sub-Registrar Office in A.P.
content: According to an official, non-judicial stamp papers in ₹50 and ₹100 denominations and stamps of ₹50 and ₹100, kept in the record room of the SRO were missing

title: Raja Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder: Meghalaya court extends judicial custody of three hitmen
content: The three were produced before the court on July 3, via video-conferencing from the Shillong district jail where they have been lodged

title: Thousands take part in Muharram procession in Srinagar
content: This is the third consecutive year that the administration has allowed the Muharram procession to be taken out on the traditional route through the heart of the city

title: Kolkata college gang rape: Police reconstruct crime scene with arrested men
content: The entire reconstruction process, carried out in the presence of a huge police team, lasted for four hours, following which the four were taken back to the police station

title: Amarnath Yatra: 6,400 pilgrims leave Jammu base camp for Kashmir
content: The third batch of 6,411 pilgrims — 4,723 men, 1,071 women, 37 children, and 580 sadhus and sadhvis — left in 291 vehicles, they said.

title: Holy water from Mahakumbh and replica of Ram Mandir: PM Modi’s gift to PM of Trinidad & Tobago
content: Modi began his first official visit to Trinidad and Tobago with a ceremonial Guard of Honour at Piarco International Airport, where he was received by Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar along with 38 ministers and four Members of Parliament of the Caribbean nation.

title: Maharashtra govt orders Mumbai's civic body to immediately shut down 'kabootar khanas'
content: Shiv Sena leader and nominated MLC Manisha Kayande said these ‘kabootar khanas’ pose a danger to the people living around them as their waste and feathers lead to respiratory diseases

title: 11 firearms, war-like stores recovered in Manipur
content: In another operation, a .32 pistol with two empty magazines and two live rounds of .32 mm ammunition were recovered

title: Karnataka rains: Holiday for schools in Shivamogga, Hosanagara taluks
content: The announcement applied to all anganwadi centres, primary schools and high schools, the release said.

title: A place of pilgrimage in Ariyalur that blends the Tamil culture with faith
content: Adaikala Madha Shrine at Elakurichi was built by Constantine Joseph Beschi in the early 18th Century CE. The wooden statue of Mother Mary at the shrine, believed to have been brought in from Manila and revered not only by Roman Catholics but also by the people of other faiths, is striking for its resemblance to a native Tamil woman

title: A castle, built in Hosur by a British Collector, is now a heap of rubble
content: Salem Collector Brett built the castle after the lady who was to be his wife demanded that he build a castle modelled on Kenilworth Castle in Warwickshire. But the district headquarters was shifted to Salem and the couple could not even set foot in the castle

title: Sri Lankan actor-politician who met MGR and Tamil groups on a political mission
content: Vijaya Kumaratunga left the Sri Lanka Freedom Party in January 1984, along with his wife Chandrika, and established the Sri Lanka Mahajana Pakshaya. He visited Madras in June 1986 to find a solution to the bitter problem of Sri Lankan Tamils. Back home, he was vilified by some elements. He was shot dead in Colombo on February 16, 1988

title: Vizag’s fight against rising homeless population
content: Visakhapatnam is witnessing a rise in homeless population, with its limited number of night shelters bursting at the seams. With just 350 beds across all the eight shelters, far from the Supreme Court mandated number, and few government-run old age homes, the city is struggling to sustain its fight against the crisis, writes Harish Gilai

title: Row over electoral roll revision: CEC says exercise will ensure all eligible citizens are included
content: He also said the revision being undertaken after a gap of 22 years is running as per schedule with the active participation of all political parties

title: Bride, betrayal and bloodshed in Telangana
content: A chilling case from Telangana has laid bare a disturbing pattern unfolding across the country — of newlywed grooms being murdered in cold blood, often by their wives in collusion with their paramours. In Gadwal, a 30-year-old youth vanished weeks after his wedding, while his bride wept and prayed for his return. But behind the tears was a calculated plot. Lavpreet Kaur tracks the tragedy

title: Andhra Pradesh’s coral presence along Visakhapatnam coast recognized in scientific journal
content: Scientific journal documents Visakhapatnam’s coral reefs in a research study done by Zoological Survey of India

title: NBA free agency winners and losers: Early results are in
content: From big-man depth to the New Orleans Pelicans, here are the early winners and losers of free agency.

title: Hammon slams Aces' 'trash' effort in 27-point loss
content: The Aces shot 26.2% and were routed 81-54 by the Fever on Thursday night, causing coach Becky Hammon to call it "one of the worst games I've ever seen."

title: Boxer Chávez Jr. arrested by ICE, to be deported
content: The family of Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. said it had "full confidence in his innocence" after he was arrested by U.S. immigration officers and set to be deported to Mexico.

title: Trump wants UFC fight on White House grounds
content: President Trump said Thursday that he's thinking of staging a UFC match on the White House grounds with upward of 20,000 spectators to celebrate 250 years of American independence.

title: 2 allegedly stole $2M+ from ex-Dolphins safety
content: A woman is in jail after she and a former financial adviser were accused of stealing millions of dollars from former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones.

title: Lynx's Reeve, Liberty's Brondello to coach ASG
content: Cheryl Reeve of the Minnesota Lynx and Sandy Brondello of the New York Liberty were tapped on Thursday as the head coaches for the upcoming WNBA All-Star Game.

title: Sources: Lakers to re-sign Hayes on 1-year deal
content: Free agent center Jaxson Hayes agreed on a one-year deal to return to the Los Angeles Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Chelsea: Grieving Neto to decide CWC availability
content: Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca said Pedro Neto is grieving the death of his close friend and Portugal teammate Diogo Jota, and the decision to play in Friday's Club World Cup quarterfinal against Palmeiras is his own.

title: Dodgers' Muncy relieved MRI clean, out 6 weeks
content: Los Angeles Dodgers third baseman Max Muncy went on the injured list Thursday because of a left knee bone bruise.

title: 🏈 Who's the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever?
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of '26. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Is this Djokovic's last chance to win a final Grand Slam?
content: Wimbledon is likely Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he possibly do it?

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players such as Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: Diego Luna has soared up the USMNT depth chart thanks to several big goals during the Gold Cup. Yet the Mexican-American playmaker is taking it all in stride and is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's final.

title: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota dies in car crash
content: Liverpool and Portugal forward Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, were killed in a car crash near Zamora, Spain, police said Thursday.

title: CWC 'difficult' for Cancelo, Neves with Jota's death
content: Al Hilal coach Simone Inzaghi has admitted Rúben Neves and João Cancelo have found it "difficult" to prepare for the FIFA Club World Cup quarterfinal against Fluminense following the death of their international teammate Diogo Jota.

title: Slot, Ronaldo lead tributes to Liverpool star Jota
content: Tributes have been paid to Liverpool forward Diogo Jota after the Portugal international and his brother, André Silva, died in a car crash in Spain.

title: Estêvão told to defeat Chelsea -- then join them
content: Palmeiras manager Abel Ferreira has told teenage winger Estêvão to showcase his talent against future employers Chelsea in the Club World Cup quarterfinals on Friday.

title: Dortmund announce Jamie Gittens exit for Chelsea
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign English winger Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, the Bundesliga club said on Thursday.

title: Ex-Arsenal star Ramsey joins Liga MX side Pumas
content: Former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey has signed with Liga MX giants Pumas, the Mexican club announced.

title: Pogba on France return: Still at 'stage one'
content: Paul Pogba has said that he hopes to make a return to the French national team but added that there are "stages" to the process, as he was presented by Monaco on Thursday.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Portugal honor Jota in Spain rout; Italy win
content: An emotional Portugal side took on Spain, while Italy beat Belgium. Here's what you need to know from Thursday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Introducing the 'Bag' Hall of Fame: Eight NFL stars who got PAID, over and over and over again
content: Which players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid open to Rodrygo exit; Arsenal keen
content: Real Madrid are open to letting forward Rodrygo leave, with Arsenal ready to swoop. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen again refused to be drawn on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton is the most successful driver at the British GP with nine wins,

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Risers and Fallers: Ionescu struggling, Canada returning to form
content: Sabrina Ionescu's recent shooting struggles and Jordin Canada's production highlight the top risers and fallers in fantasy this week.

title: Rain alert persists for a few Western Ghats districts this week
content: RMC has issued a yellow weather alert for the Ghat areas of Coimbatore and the Nilgiris districts till tomorrow; Chennai may get evening showers today

title: Supreme Court collegium clears 36 names for appointment as judges in various State High Courts
content: The collegium also approved a proposal for the appointment of 10 judicial officers as judges of the Punjab and Haryana High Court

title: Bengaluru’s upcoming aerotropolis promises to be a smart, sustainable city
content: A futuristic Bengaluru Airport City will be developed on the KIA premises over the next decade. Spread over 463 acres, it will have business parks, a global innovation hub, an education and health district, a retail dining entertainment village, a concert arena, and more. The Hindu gets an exclusive peek into what the future holds.

title: L-G is interfering in functioning of J&K’s Information Dept., delaying ‘Business Rules’, says NC’s Tanvir Sadiq
content: There has been persistent friction between the Raj Bhavan and the J&K government ever since an elected government took over the reins of the Union Territory in October 2024

title: Contractual employees are entitled to maternity leave, reiterates Orissa High Court
content: ‘Women employees, for the purpose of availing such benefit, do constitute one homogenous class, and their artificial bifurcation founded on status of appointment falls foul of Article 14 of the Constitution,’ the Division Bench ruled

title: Indian community’s journey in Trinidad and Tobago a courageous one: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Persad-Bissessar, who addressed the community before Mr. Modi, said that the Indian leader will be conferred on Friday (July 4, 2025) with ‘The Order of Trinidad and Tobago’, the Caribbean nation’s highest honour

title: Odisha BJP leader arrested over assault on govt. officer; civil servants return to work
content: Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation was dragged out of his office and assaulted on June 30; videos of the incident went viral, sparking outrage, mass protest by civil servants that severely affected the functioning of State government offices

title: Gujarat HC grants Asaram Bapu his ‘final’ bail extension
content: The Division Bench of Justices Ilesh Vora and PM Raval rejected Asaram’s lawyer’s request for a three-month extension, granting only 30 additional days. This follows the court’s previous interim extension from June 30 to July 7.

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Ground beneath their feet
content: The 800-year-old, ₹1,400 crore Kolhapuri chappal industry employs close to 1 lakh artisans, and is spread across four districts each of Maharashtra and Karnataka. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit explores the trade and the tradition of this all-leather, nature-derived, hand-stitched footwear, which has been GI tagged. The craft lacks policy impetus, often leading to its misappropriation, the exploitation of its already-marginalised kaarigars, and an erasure of culture

title: Centre on the defensive over Congress’s accusations of ‘subverting’ Forest Act
content: Allegations of subverting forest rights act reflects gross misunderstanding of facts: Environment Ministry

title: Chief Minister inaugurates 208 urban health and wellness centres, 60 PHCs across Tamil Nadu
content: The urban health and wellness centres will function from 8 a.m. and 12 noon and from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. and offer outpatient care, disease screening, lifestyle counselling, health education, immunisations, and drug delivery, among others

title: Key projects in Ernakulam reviewed at Chief Minister’s regional conference
content: The meeting decided to resolve issues related to the distribution of title deeds in Kothamangalam taluk within a month

title: Kidnapped boy found dead inside forest in Krishnagiri district
content: His body was located following an interrogation of the two persons last seen with him. According the police, the suspects claimed that they had murdered the boy who was from Mavanatti village in Anchetty

title: Married woman cannot claim she was coerced into sex on false promise of marriage, says Kerala HC
content: Court grants bail to a person in a case where he allegedly sexually assaulted a married woman on the pretext of marriage and threatened to publish her photos and videos, after borrowing ₹2.5 lakh from her

title: I&B Ministry proposes amendments to rules for TV rating agencies
content: The proposed draft removes some restrictive provisions for media houses to allow more players besides the current Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) to democratise the television audience measurement ecosystem

title: Sivaganga custodial death: autopsy of victim reveals 44 external injuries
content: The autopsy, performed at the Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai on June 29, revealed several abrasions and contusions caused by thrashings and kickings.

title: Kerala CM flags media leak from Governor’s office, calls for adherence to procedure
content: Pinarayi Vijayan refers to media reports suggesting that Governor Rajendra Arlekar had expressed his displeasure to new State Police Chief Ravada A. Chandrasekhar regarding issues pertaining to the appointment of security staff

title: Day 4: Protesting FMGs taken away to police stations, detained for nearly 5 hours
content: Government is in favour of the FMGs, and APMC members will be going to New Delhi next week to get clarity from the National Medical Commission regarding internship duration, says APMC Chairman

title: Opposition seeks apology over MLC’s ‘urban Naxal’ remark on wari pilgrimage
content: Holding copies of the Constitution, Opposition parties staged a protest at the Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan on Thursday, slamming Shiv Sena MLC Manisha Kayande’s remarks alleging “urban Naxal” infiltration in the Pandharpur wari pilgrimage.

title: WB CPI(M) demands judicial inquiry in tendering process of Deocha Pachami coal project
content: CPI(M) State Secretary Md Salim alleges breach of tender, agreement violations in Deocha Pachami coal project

title: Rajeev Kumar Sharma takes charge as Rajasthan DGP in Jaipur
content: The appointment was made on the basis of a recommendation made by the empanelment committee, which was formed by the Union Public Service Commission

title: Maharashtra rolls out round-the-clock sand transport, new measures to regulate mining
content: The move is part of a broader reform that includes GPS tracking, CCTV monitoring, and free sand distribution for housing scheme beneficiaries

title: SRMIST-The Hindu to organise webinar on Future Career Conversations
content: The webinar will delve into the dynamic healthcare landscape and highlight the skill sets required by future doctors and dentists in the era of technological disruptions

title: Preparatory work for Census 2027 begins with conference of Directors of Census Operations
content: Before the first phase begins, a pre-test exercise will be held where tentative questions will be asked by enumerators. The notification for pre-test is likely to be issued in August, a senior government official said.

title: U.P. Cabinet approves ₹4,775 crore expressway linking Agra-Lucknow and Purvanchal corridors
content: According to the government, the proposed expressway will be constructed as a six-lane carriageway, expandable to eight lanes, and will span approximately 49.96 kilometres

title: Put union rooms under lock and key: Calcutta HC directs Bengal govt. after Kolkata law college gang rape case
content: The direction by a Division Bench came while hearing a PIL petition over gang rape incident in a law college in Kolkata last week; the survivor of the sexual assault has claimed that she was confined in the union room of the college

title: INDIA bloc to explore legal options to challenge voter list special revision in Bihar
content: RJD leader Manoj Jha said that the Election Commission’s stance on the migrant population imperils voting rights of people from the Dalit, Backward and minority communities, as they are the ones who usually travel out of the State seeking work

title: Student visa applicants must make their social media public: U.S. Embassy
content: U.S. visa a privilege, not a right, says the Embassy as it lays down the requirement for students seeking visas

title: Mixed reactions to Karnataka’s decision to withdraw permit exemption for electric public transport vehicles
content: In a circular issued on Tuesday, the department revoked the earlier provision that allowed these vehicles to operate without permits, which was in line with the Union Road Transport Ministry’s October 18, 2018, order

title: Global South’s voice key to contemporary world’s progress: PM Modi tells Ghana’s Parliament
content: The Prime Minister calls for global governance reforms to deal with the changing world order, pledging to stand with Ghana as a ‘pillar of strength’

title: Take action against judges who show caste bias in rulings, Congress urges CJI
content: The party cited a recent ruling by the Odisha High Court in which an activist was told to clean a police station for three months as bail conditions

title: ‘Big Beautiful’ speech: This Democrat spoke for over 8 hrs; GOP passed bill right after
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: India’s ‘Trump Card’ on trade deal? How India can handle US pressure and seal agreement
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce and can navigate the complexities of the business world .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Top 50 trade deadline candidates -- and their best landing spots
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: Ranking the best available free agents after the initial rush
content: new contracts have come at a fast and furious pace during the opening hours of free agency . 18 of my top 25 potential free agents had already found landing spots . there are players available who could make a difference next season and beyond .

title: A new world in Big Apple baseball: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Madden NFL 26 features a fully reworked Superstar mode
content: superstar mode is celebrating its 20th anniversary in Madden NFL 26 . the integration with College Football's Road to Glory mode returns as well . players will get realistic opportunities on the field to replace an injured player or wrap up a dominant victory from time to time .

title: Luna eclipse: No stars, no problem as USMNT finds new focal point

title: Kershaw joins the 3K club! Where does he rank among pitchers with 3,000 strikeouts?
